Package com.satyajeet.addressbook

Class AddressBook

java.lang.Object
com.satyajeet.addressbook.AddressBook
public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
Address Book Library This address book library can be used to create a new address book and store/modify/delete entries with values like Name, Postal Address, Phone Number, Email Address, Notes. This library additionally allows the user to store the list of entries as a JSON file and also allows the user to load an address book from a JSON file in predefined format. The list of addresses added are stored as a SortedSet of AddressBook.AddressBookEntry objects.
Since:
2020-02-18
Version:
1.0
Author:
Satyajeet Maharana

  • Method Details

    • getAddressBookEntries

      public java.util.Collection<com.satyajeet.addressbook.AddressBook.AddressBookEntry> getAddressBookEntries()
      This is method is used to return an unmodifiable set of the AddressBook.AddressBookEntry objects.
      Returns:
      Returns an unmodifiable set of the AddressBookEntry objects.

    • addEntry

      public java.lang.String addEntry​(java.lang.String name, com.satyajeet.addressbook.AddressBook.AddressBookEntry.PostalAddress postalAddress, java.lang.String phoneNumber, java.lang.String emailAddress, java.lang.String note) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to add an entry to the AddressBook object.
      Parameters:
      name - This argument is the name of the AddressBookEntry to be inserted.
      postalAddress - This argument is the postal address of the AddressBookEntry to be inserted.
      phoneNumber - This argument is the phone number of the AddressBookEntry to be inserted.
      emailAddress - This argument is the email address of the AddressBookEntry to be inserted.
      note - This argument is the note associated with the AddressBookEntry to be inserted.
      Returns:
      String returns the Id string of the inserted AddressBookEntry object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws exception if the Phone Number or the Email Address fields are not as per the described formats. See Docs.

    • removeEntry

      public java.lang.Boolean removeEntry​(java.lang.String entryToDeleteIdStr) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to delete an AddressBook.AddressBookEntry from the current list of entries.
      Parameters:
      entryToDeleteIdStr - This is the string representing the AddressBookEntry Id.
      Returns:
      Boolean returns true if an address book entry with the given entryToDeleteIdStr is found, else returns false if no such address book entry with the given Id is found.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws exception if no entry with the given Id is found. See Docs.

    • updateEntry

      public java.lang.Boolean updateEntry​(java.lang.String entryToUpdateIdStr, java.lang.Boolean overwriteWithBlanks, java.lang.String name, com.satyajeet.addressbook.AddressBook.AddressBookEntry.PostalAddress postalAddress, java.lang.String phoneNumber, java.lang.String emailAddress, java.lang.String note) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to update an address book entry associated with the provided Id in the address book. Use caution : If overwriteWithBlanks argument is set to true,the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten. Please see overwriteWithBlanks. This might lead to possible data loss if not used properly.
      Parameters:
      entryToUpdateIdStr - This argument is the Id in String format of the Address Book Entry to be updated
      overwriteWithBlanks - Default value is "False". If the value is set to "True", the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten.
      name - This argument is the new value of name of the AddressBookEntry to be updated.
      postalAddress - This argument is the new value of postal address of the AddressBookEntry to be updated.
      phoneNumber - This argument is the new value of phone number of the AddressBookEntry to be updated.
      emailAddress - This argument is the new value of email address of the AddressBookEntry to be updated.
      note - This argument is the new value of note associated with the AddressBookEntry to be updated.
      Returns:
      Boolean returns true if file is successfully updated, false if the file was not successfully updated.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws exception if the Phone Number or the Email Address fields are not as per the described formats or if no address book entry is found for the given Id. See Docs.

    • updateEntryName

      public java.lang.Boolean updateEntryName​(java.lang.String entryToUpdateIdStr, java.lang.String name, java.lang.Boolean overwriteWithBlank) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to update the name of an address book entry associated with the Id provided. Use caution : If overwriteWithBlanks argument is set to true,the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten. Please see overwriteWithBlanks. This might lead to possible data loss if not used properly.
      Parameters:
      entryToUpdateIdStr - This argument is the Id in String format of the Address Book Entry to be updated
      name - This argument is value of Name to be updated for the address book entry.
      overwriteWithBlank - Default value is "False". If the value is set to "True", the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten.
      Returns:
      Boolean returns true if file is successfully updated, false if the file was not successfully updated.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws exception if no entry with the given Id is found. See Docs.

    • updateEntryPostalAddress

      public java.lang.Boolean updateEntryPostalAddress​(java.lang.String entryToUpdateIdStr, com.satyajeet.addressbook.AddressBook.AddressBookEntry.PostalAddress postalAddress, java.lang.Boolean overwriteWithBlank)
      This method is used to update the postal address of an address book entry associated with the Id provided. Use caution : If overwriteWithBlanks argument is set to true,the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten. Please see overwriteWithBlanks. This might lead to possible data loss if not used properly.
      Parameters:
      entryToUpdateIdStr - This argument is the Id in String format of the Address Book Entry to be updated
      postalAddress - This argument is PostalAddress object to be updated for the address book entry.
      overwriteWithBlank - Default value is "False". If the value is set to "True", the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten.
      Returns:
      Boolean returns true if file is successfully updated, false if the file was not successfully updated.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws exception if no entry with the given Id is found. See Docs.

    • updateEntryPhoneNumber

      public java.lang.Boolean updateEntryPhoneNumber​(java.lang.String entryToUpdateIdStr, java.lang.String phoneNumber, java.lang.Boolean overwriteWithBlank) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to update the phone number of an address book entry associated with the Id provided. Use caution : If overwriteWithBlanks argument is set to true,the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten. Please see overwriteWithBlanks. This might lead to possible data loss if not used properly.
      Parameters:
      entryToUpdateIdStr - This argument is the Id in String format of the Address Book Entry to be updated
      phoneNumber - This argument is value of phone number to be updated for the address book entry.
      overwriteWithBlank - Default value is "False". If the value is set to "True", the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten.
      Returns:
      Boolean returns true if file is successfully updated, false if the file was not successfully updated.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws IllegalArgumentException if the phone number is in invalid format or if no address book entry is found for the given Id. Please see the doc.

This might lead to possible data loss if not used properly.

      Returns:
      Boolean returns true if file is successfully updated, false if the file was not successfully updated.

    • updateEntryNote

      public java.lang.Boolean updateEntryNote​(java.lang.String entryToUpdateIdStr, java.lang.String note, java.lang.Boolean overwriteWithBlank)
      This method is used to update the note of an address book entry associated with the Id provided. Use caution : If overwriteWithBlanks argument is set to true,the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten. Please see overwriteWithBlanks. This might lead to possible data loss if not used properly.
      Parameters:
      entryToUpdateIdStr - This argument is the Id in String format of the Address Book Entry to be updated
      note - This argument is value of note to be updated for the address book entry.
      overwriteWithBlank - Default value is "False". If the value is set to "True", the blank or empty strings provided in the argument will be overwritten.
      Returns:
      Boolean returns true if file is successfully updated, false if the file was not successfully updated.

      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws exception if no entry with the given Id is found. See Docs.

    • searchEntries

      public java.util.List<com.satyajeet.addressbook.AddressBook.AddressBookEntry> searchEntries​(java.lang.String searchTerm)
      This method is used to search the entire address book by matching the search term provided. A list of all the matching AddressBookEntry objects are returned. The order of matching is done as follows : 1. matching Name 2. matching Phone Number 3. matching Email Address 4. matching Postal Address 5. matching Notes
      Parameters:
      searchTerm - This is the string representing the search term
      Returns:
      Returns the list of all matching AddressBookEntry records. Ordering is described in the doc. Returns empty list of no search term provided.

    • saveToFile

      public java.lang.Boolean saveToFile​(java.lang.String filePointer) throws com.google.gson.JsonIOException, java.io.IOException
      This method is used to save the address book to a file in JSON format. The JSON format as given below: 
       JSON format
 [
          {
            "Address_Book_Entry_Id": "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX",
            "Name": "string",
            "Postal_Address": {
              "Street_1": "string",
              "Street_2": "string",
              "City": "string",
              "State": "string",
              "Postal_Code": "string",
              "Country": "string"
            },
            "Phone_Number": "X XXX XXX XXXX",
            "Email_Address": "XXXX@XXXX.XXX",
            "Note": "string"
          },....
]
      Parameters:
      filePointer - This argument is the file path from where the address book is to be stored.
      Returns:
      True if the file is saved successfully, False if the file is not saved successfully
      Throws:
      com.google.gson.JsonIOException - This exception is raised when Gson is unable to read an input stream or write to one.
      java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

    • readFromFile

      public static AddressBook readFromFile​(java.lang.String filePointer) throws com.google.gson.JsonIOException, com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException, java.io.IOException
      This method is used to read the address book from a file. A new instance of AddressBook class is created and populated by this method. The new instance of AddressBook is returned 
       JSON format
 [
          {
            "Address_Book_Entry_Id": "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX",
            "Name": "string",
            "Postal_Address": {
              "Street_1": "string",
              "Street_2": "string",
              "City": "string",
              "State": "string",
              "Postal_Code": "string",
              "Country": "string"
            },
            "Phone_Number": "X XXX XXX XXXX",
            "Email_Address": "XXXX@XXXX.XXX",
            "Note": "string"
          },....
]
      Parameters:
      filePointer - This argument is the file path from where the address book is to be read.
      Returns:
      AddressBook
      Throws:
      com.google.gson.JsonIOException - This exception is raised when Gson is unable to read an input stream or write to one.
      com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - This exception is raised when Gson attempts to read (or write) a malformed JSON element.
      java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
